Keyterm: I - Model LA, 2 PCLM, Approved February 24, 1936.

Info:
Maximum, except takeoff -- in. Hg., 1950 rpm, 70 hp 
 Takeoff (one minute) -- in. Hg., 1950 rpm, 70 hp

Level flight or climb - 120 mph Ind. 
 Glide or dive - 162 mph Ind. 
 Flaps (See Item 17) - 108 mph Ind.
28 gallons (one tank at 19 gallons in right wing (+27) and one at 9 gallons in fuselage (-11)
2000 and up manufactured prior to 9/30/39 eligible. Approval expired as of that date.

Keyterm: II - Model LB, 2 PCLM, Approved February 24, 1936.

Info:
(a) Maximum, except takeoff -- in. Hg., 2125 rpm (85 hp) 
 Takeoff (one minute) -- in. Hg., 2125 rpm (85 hp)

Level flight or climb - 120 mph Ind. 
 Glide or dive - 162 mph Ind. 
 Flaps (See Item 17) - 108 mph Ind.
28 gallons (one tank at 19 gallons in right wing (+27) and one at 9 gallons in fuselage (-11)
2000 and up manufactured prior to 9/30/39 eligible. Approval expired as of that date.

Propeller - wood (fixed or adjustable pitch)

 (-45)

Flares - three 1 min. (reduce baggage 15 lbs.) 
 10 lbs. 
 (+80)

Flares - five 1 min. (reduce baggage 23 lbs.) 
 15 lbs. 
 (+80)

Flares - three 1-1/2 min. (reduce baggage 26 lbs.)

Two 6-volt hot shot batteries for radio 
 20 lbs. 
 (+39)

Eligible for export subject to inspection for equipment specified in Chapter III of Inspection Handbook: (April 9, 1937) 
 (a) 
 Canada 
 - Landplane 
 - Skiplane -- not eligible 
 (b) 
 All other countries except Great Britain and Australia.

Aircraft eligible are also approved with: 
 (a) 
 Conventional or differential aileron control with cable and push-pull tube 
 control systems respectively. 
 (b) 
 Flap operating mechanism including automobile window type lift. 
 (c) 
 Brake operating mechanism, including pedals, located between the rudder 
 pedals and interconnected to a hand lever at the upper left side of the cabin.
